Description: Rim sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; traces of handle at lower left break; interior: on rim, four dilute lines between black bands; reserved band at top of wall; exterior: rim glazed; reserved area at turn to handle zone; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B2
Curator's comments: Edgar incorrectly identifies the sherd as Chian. The exterior and interior surfaces have been burnt. Although Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012) does not discuss this cup, the profile and decoration finds parallels to his Type 9B South Ionian cup with everted rim. Type 9B cups closely follow the shape and decoration of the Attic Plain Komast cups. These cups coincide with Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type IX (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116) and Villard’s Ionian Cup Type B2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). Type 9 cups have been found in large numbers in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra, and at the site of Megara Hyblaea on Sicily. This type was the most common type of South Ionian cups with everted rims found at Naukratis. The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape.
Though burnt, it is clear the exterior of the lip was glazed.
Bibliographic references: Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (no. 15)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 696, no. 537)
Höckmann & Möller 2006 / The Hellenion at Naukratis: Questions and Observations (p.14 fig.7)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.613) (Phase 3)
